title: Proxima Centauri b
short_description: A rocky exoplanet orbiting Proxima Centauri, the closest star to the Sun, located about 4.24 light-years away in the habitable zone.

title: Kepler-452b
short_description: Kepler-452b is a super-Earth orbiting a sun-like star, located 1,400 light-years away. It's one of the most Earth-like exoplanets found.

title: WASP-121b
short_description: WASP-121b is a gas giant exoplanet located 850 light-years away, with scorching temperatures high enough to evaporate metals.

title: HD 189733b
short_description: A gas giant with a blue color due to high-temperature clouds. It is located 64.5 light-years away and is known for its violent winds.

title: TRAPPIST-1e
short_description: One of the seven Earth-sized planets orbiting the TRAPPIST-1 star, TRAPPIST-1e is located in the habitable zone and may be a rocky world.

title: Gliese 581g
short_description: Gliese 581g is a potentially habitable exoplanet located 20 light-years away. It resides in the habitable zone of the red dwarf star Gliese 581.

title: Kepler-186f
short_description: Kepler-186f is an Earth-sized exoplanet located in its star's habitable zone, about 500 light-years away. It has the potential to harbor liquid water.

title: 55 Cancri e
short_description: 55 Cancri e is a rocky exoplanet with a surface temperature exceeding 2,000Â°C. It's located 41 light-years away and is thought to have lava oceans.

title: LHS 1140b
short_description: A super-Earth exoplanet located 40 light-years away, LHS 1140b lies in the habitable zone and may have an atmosphere suitable for life.

title: K2-18b
short_description: K2-18b is a super-Earth exoplanet with potential for life, located 124 light-years away. It has water vapor in its atmosphere.

title: GJ 1214b
short_description: GJ 1214b is a 'water world' exoplanet located 48 light-years away. It may have a thick atmosphere and is a prime target for atmospheric study.

title: HD 209458b
short_description: A gas giant exoplanet, HD 209458b was the first planet observed to have an atmosphere evaporating into space. It's located 159 light-years away.

title: Kepler-22b
short_description: Kepler-22b is a super-Earth located 600 light-years away in the habitable zone. It may have a surface temperature conducive to liquid water.

title: HR 8799c
short_description: HR 8799c is a young, massive exoplanet about 130 light-years away. It's part of a multi-planet system and has been directly imaged.

title: PSR B1257+12 c
short_description: A pulsar planet, PSR B1257+12 c orbits a neutron star and is located about 2,300 light-years away. It was one of the first exoplanets discovered.

title: HD-189733b
short_description: HD 189733b is a deep blue gas giant located 64.5 light-years away. Its atmosphere features extreme winds and glass-like particles, causing sideways 'glass rain.'

title: Kepler-438b
short_description: Kepler-438b is a potentially habitable exoplanet 640 light-years away. It's similar in size to Earth and lies in its star's habitable zone.

title: OGLE-2005-BLG-390Lb
short_description: This icy, Earth-sized exoplanet is located about 21,500 light-years away. It's one of the most distant exoplanets discovered.

title: Tau Ceti e
short_description: Tau Ceti e is a super-Earth in the habitable zone of the star Tau Ceti, located 12 light-years away. It could potentially support life.

title: Kapteyn b
short_description: Kapteyn b is a potentially habitable exoplanet located 13 light-years away. It orbits an ancient star, making it one of the oldest known planets.
